Heat flow.Description: Conduction is a form of heat transfer where heat flows through a solid or stationary fluid by direct contact.
Convection is a form of heat transfer where heat flows through a fluid by the movement of the fluid itself.
Radiation is a form of heat transfer where heat flows through electromagnetic waves, such as infrared radiation.
Insulation helps reduce heat flow by providing a barrier to the transfer of heat between two objects with different temperatures.
